TopicTitle: What will be the first thing you will do in 0.23?

Articles.Content: Go to Jool and save Jeb from the Kraken with an epic SSTO spaceplane with the Sabre engines

1. Hope all the mods I have installed work

2. Start a new career

3. Uninstall the mods that don't (please at least give us the universe replacer, I can't go back to the old Kerbin)

4. Start a new career again

5. More probes, better planned manned missions, less rescue missions.

6. Finally get around to designing a reliable SSTO plane.

Utilize the hidden blessing in the tweakables that will help get better payloads before asparagus can be used. I won't tell anyone unless I start a series. And I also hope that some new options will be available in the action groups.

So, I would get more payload into orbit, and also less back home onto Kerbin, due to EVA transfer. YAY!

People... Its called a RAPIER.

That said.... Tweak all the things, make helluvalot of awesome SSTO

Make sure everything still works.

Check out some of the tweakable options.

Add a science lab to my Duna Habitat, and test it in my other 'sim' save to make sure it will land safely.
I am going to build a Skylon out of the new RAPIER engines, and attempt to make it carry cargo into LKO.
Start a new career ! First objectives; mun base with science lab (BIOMES XP) + exploring minmus.

I'll be going not going to space!

not my image, just emphasizes my point...
Sending rover based labs to planets. For science!!! Oh wait, how much science will I need to unlock this?
New game, get a feel for the new features and then start another new game when tech tree updates.
Restart career mode. Tweak the small SRB to get Jeb even higher up!

Sending rover based labs to planets. For science!!! Oh wait, how much science will I need to unlock this?

I believe the labs have to be manned by two Kerbal, as for the cost in the tech tree I am uncertain offhand.
Check to see if my save has broken and then checking to see if the new versions of my mods work with the old versions.
launch pod, crew report, collect stuff from the launch pad, do an EVA report and retrieve it. Unlock science and start launching stuff.

Hopefully have fun and not be dissapointed, then remind myself resources were cancelled.

What is this "resources" thing people keep mentioning?
Visit the new Bionomes.
Strap a plane onto the side of a rocket and tweak the thrust so it doesn't go all flippy like off the pad.

Crash, crash until I get crashed.

Then crash some more!

(1) "Launch" a manned pod.

(2) Get out. Sample launch pad. Do eva report.

(3) Get back into pod.

(4) Get out again.

(5) Walk to grass.

(6) Sample grass, do eva report.

(7) Return to pod

(8) Recover vessel.

(9) Advance tech tree.

(10) Continue grinding until I have access to sufficient equipment (ie docking ports) to launch a proper science station.

(11) Actually try the new content.
Go to Jool and do science... with a 3 man pod... return them to Kerbin (almost did this in .22, but then a .1 degree plane imbalance screwed me over)
Discover the TWR of the R.A.P.I.E.R engines.

Honestly, choosing between an orbiting science station and using the RAPIER to make a dirt simple SSTO spaceplane will be pretty challenging. I might just stare at KSC for half an hour trying to decide. Then I'll make an SSTO with the RAPIER, remember I can't fly to save my life, then launch a science lab into orbit.

(1) "Launch" a manned pod.

(2) Get out. Sample launch pad. Do eva report.

(3) Get back into pod.

Why do you do that? You start with rockets already, I don't see the purpose of walking.

(4) Get out again.

(5) Walk to grass.

(6) Sample grass, do eva report.

(7) Return to pod

(8) Recover vessel.

Again, why not take a rocket to a more distant biome? You're shooting yourself in the fun here.

(9) Advance tech tree.

(10) Continue grinding until I have access to sufficient equipment (ie docking ports) to launch a proper science station.

Let me just say that Skylab was sent up in one piece, and also there's no need to grind. There are more than enough destinations in the solar system to get enough science without doing boring things like sending the same ship to the same place repeatedly.

(11) Actually try the new content.

But this time, have fun on the journey there too.

Crash, crash until I get crashed.

Then crash some more!

This. So much this.
Open my save game!
